content.description: From the guidebook: "Start on a flat rail at head height and move up and left to top out on the left face."Note: It seems that this line doesn’t exist and is just a holdover from a previous guide that incorrectly put the climb there. If climbed, it would be significantly harder than v3. The line you are likely looking for is Project Mayhem.
content.location: Boulder #10 in the guidebook. Part of the first densely packed section just up and left from the entrance.

content.description: Stand Start on obvious rail, work some funky moves on wrong way holds to a good ledge. easy top out.
content.location: to the left of the fight club boulder, to the right of trust. tucked away in the far left side of the garden near the road.

content.description: Sit start matched on the slopey lower left arete of the Fight Club boulder and climb right, finishing as for Fight Club. This one's significantly harder and a bit more morpho than the right side line.
content.protection: A few pads. You start on a rock jutting up from the ground, which would make for an uncomfortable (but safe) fall at the beginning.

content.description: The original test piece of the area. Compression, toe and heel hook moves out the right side of the bubble boulder lead you to a sloppey top out.  Start right hand for ear and left on the left side of the arete.
content.location: Same boulder as the ear. This line goes directly out the overhang on its right side.

content.description: Ear looking face of the overhanging boulder in the inner sanctum. Crux is the top out.
content.location: Obvious two-hand match start. Move up the face and over the sloping lip.

content.description: From the Guidebook: "Stand start and lie back the right side of the boulder, using the Fight Club boulder for feet."
content.location: Boulder #10 in the guidebook. Part of the first densely packed section just up and left from the entrance.

content.description: Sit start on a small side pull and an edge on the underside. Complete several techincal moves to a small crimp. Fire to the sloping jug on the lip. The crux is hitting the lip hold without cutting, as well as keeping your fingers from bleeding on the crimp.
content.protection: Several pads, the more the merrier.
content.location: Shares the left side of the same boulder as The Ear on the Fight Club boulder.

content.description: One of the most distinct boulders in the area, the fightclub boulder has an interesting "dog food" texture which gives the climb on this rock a unique feel. The neighboring Tyler Durten boulder is included in this area as well.
